meanings.definition: To break apart or separate into pieces.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was sundering the branches from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was sundering the ground, creating deep cracks.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician's spell went wrong, sundering his hat into two pieces.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunder sundered the peaceful silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The knight's sword sundered the enemy's shield with a single strike.

meanings.definition: To cause a division or rift between two things or people.
meanings.sent1: Misunderstandings can easily lead to sundering friendships.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words spoken in anger were sundering their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was sundering the calm between the two cats.
meanings.sent4: The political scandal sundered the unity of the community.
meanings.sent5: The differences in opinions were sundering the once close-knit team.
